overview_of_class:
Continuation of 310-1. Convolution, central limit theorem, Markov processes in discrete time, recurrence, and transience. Students may not receive credit for both 310-1 and any of 385, EECS 302, IEMS 202, or STAT 320-1, 383. Prerequisites: 234, 240.

THIS COURSE HAS MANDATORY EVENING MIDTERM EXAMINATIONS FROM 630-730 PM ON TUESDAY, FEB 2ND and TUESDAY, MAR 1ST. PLEASE CHECK THE REGISTRAR'S WEBPAGE FOR DETAILS: http://www.registrar.northwestern.edu/registration/midterms.html

This exam takes precedence over scheduled meetings of other classes, including labs and discussion sections, held at this time, and it is up to the student to make arrangements for handling conflicts arising from such meetings. In special circumstances, arrangements for dealing with other unavoidable conflicts can be made by alerting the course coordinator at least two weeks ahead of time; he/she will decide if your conflict can be accommodated.
name: Probability and Stochastic Processes
subject: MATH
